comments.body: Why are we just testing the `Principal` policy? Should we also test the other built-in policies to make sure they're instantiated and used properly?
The individual policies have their own unit tests. Also, in these tests, we are explicitly creating an instance of the policy and passing it around.

How about adding some tests where multiple variables are used in a single value? I think the logic cares only if one can be found, but it still would be nice to verify.

Also, currently all of the variables are at the end -- how about some where they are at the beginning and middle with additional content besides the variable?

Also, what about other variable formats? Variables are of the form `${file:path:key}` (per [KIP-297](https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/KAFKA/KIP-297%3A+Externalizing+Secrets+for+Connect+Configurations)), so maybe some without a path and very simple file, path, and key values.
Added multiple cases here. Hope this helps. Thanks!
